page.title: 09MELCHETT MERE
page.content: SUBSIDENCE CAUSED THIS AREA OF WATER TO APPEAR QUITE SUDDENLY IN 1929 AND IT IS INCREASING IN SIZE BY HALF AN ACRE A YEAR. REPTON'S PLANS INCLUDED WATER IN ALMOST THE SAME PLACE. ON A MISTY OCTOBER DAY I WALKED THE MARKED TRAIL WATCHING THE SKEINS OF CANADA GEESE AS THEY CIRCLED, CACKLING LOUDLY AS THEY SPLASHED DOWN AND ARGUED OVER POSITION. THE BLACK BLOBS OF COOTS, TUFTED DUCK, MALLARDS AND A LONE SWAN IGNORED THEM. AUTUMN COLOURS, BROWSING SHEEP, DEER UNDER THE TREES AND GRAZING CATTLE ADDED TO THE INTEREST FOR NATURALISTS; HAREBELLS AND TOADSTOOLS IN THE LONG GRASS. ANGLING CONTESTS ARE HELD TWICE A YEAR FOR PIKE. THE MARKED TRAIL ALSO INCLUDES THE REMAINS OF AN EARLIER ICE HOUSE.
